sentence.Network_en: This book I inscribe to my old comrades - in - arms.
sentence.Network_cn: 谨将本书献给我的老战友们.

sentence.Network_en: Will you inscribe your name in the book?
sentence.Network_cn: 能否请你在这本书上签名?

sentence.Network_en: What then is the overall strategic concept which we should inscribe today?
sentence.Network_cn: 那么今天什么样的“全面战略概念”是我们应当题写的 呢 ?

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin inscribere, from in- 'into' + scribere 'write'

entry.def: If you inscribe words on an object, you write or carve the words on the object.

example.ex: Some galleries commemorate donors by inscribing their names on the walls...
example.tran: 一些美术馆把捐赠者的姓名镌刻在墙上以示纪念。

example.ex: She and Mark read the words inscribed on the inner walls of the monument.
example.tran: 她和马克读了刻在纪念碑内墙上的文字。

entry.def: If you inscribe something in the front of a book or on a photograph, you write it there, often before giving it to someone.

example.ex: On the back I had inscribed the words: 'Here's to Great Ideas! John'...
example.tran: 在背后我题写了这样的话：“愿奇思妙想不绝！约翰”。

example.ex: The book is inscribed: To John Arlott from Laurie Lee.
example.tran: 书的题赠是：献给约翰·阿洛特——劳丽·李。

means.word_mean: 1. carve, cut, or etch into a material or surface;

sentences.sentence: "engraved the winner's name onto the trophy cup"

means.word_mean: 2. register formally as a participant or member;
3. draw within a figure so as to touch in as many places as possible
4. write, engrave, or print as a lasting record

sentences.sentence: "We should encode the message for security reasons"

means.word_mean: 7. address, as a work of literature, in a style less formal than a dedication

auth_sentence.content: I inscribe this missive...in the style of...courteous sages of yore.
auth_sentence.res_content: I inscribe this missive...in the style of...courteous sages of yore.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I inscribe this missive...in the style of...courteous sages of yore.

auth_sentence.content: Mr Kob explains that it is not enough to learn how to inscribe the intricate designs on people's bodies.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr Kob explains that it is not enough to learn how to inscribe the intricate designs on people's bodies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr Kob explains that it is not enough to learn how to inscribe the intricate designs on people's bodies.

auth_sentence.content: Some of the energy that stirred it is defiance, a desire to say: We can run our own affairs, inscribe our own images.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some of the energy that stirred it is defiance, a desire to say: We can run our own affairs, inscribe our own images.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some of the energy that stirred it is defiance, a desire to say: We can run our own affairs, inscribe our own images.

means.word_mean: 写;刻；题 ~ A （on/in B)/~ B with A

sentences.en: The names of the dead were inscribed on the wall.
sentences.cn: 死者的名字被刻在墙上。

sentences.en: The trophy was inscribed with his name.
